definition: letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives

sentences.english: Have the hearers been convicted of their sin by the Law?
sentences.chinese: 信众因着律法已经被定罪了吗？

sentences.english: The missionaries were confronted with a conservative, almost fanatical form of Islam.
sentences.chinese: 传教士要面对保守甚至狂热的伊斯兰信众。

sentences.english: All believers are in partnership with the Lord (2 Cor.
sentences.chinese: 所有的信众都是与神同工的。

sentences.english: This irritated the Pope, who wants to lord over all Catholic believers in the world.
sentences.chinese: 这激怒了教宗，而教宗想掌管全世界的天主教信众。

sentences.english: Its members, who numbered in the hundreds, were instructed not to vote.
sentences.chinese: 它的信众成百上千，都被指使不参与投票选举。

sentences.english: This Pope's influence goes far beyond the spiritual inspiration of his flock.
sentences.chinese: 教皇的影响力远远超越了对其信众的精神鼓舞。

sentences.english: Followers and visitors have been loyal t the temple and oblations are always given to it.
sentences.chinese: 信众游客对红庙一直虔诚有加，香火不绝。

sentences.english: The doctrine sermon should still have exposition of the sermon text(s), and applications to the hearers' lives.
sentences.chinese: 教义式讲道仍要解释讲道经文，应用于信众的生活。

sentences.english: As a result, a significant number of mainstream believers in Kyrgyzstan remain wary of the government.
sentences.chinese: 这使得该国许多普通信众不由得对政府保持一份警惕。

sentences.english: Clergy and laity alike are divided in their views.
sentences.chinese: 神职人员和信众同样都观点各异。

sentences.english: They teach believers to choose sticks, read tea leaves, palms, or stars;
sentences.chinese: 他们教导信众去选木条子，看茶叶，睇掌，观星相等。

definition: to worship/to make customary deferences to/a pilgrimage
to go on a pilgrimage and offer incense (idiom)
